reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel that is going through a renovation in excess of 60 million dollars. VERY NICE ROOMS. Roomy and clean.
reviews.title: Wailea Marriot is a favorite

likes.disliked: — The MYSTERY: Why do hotels that charge $100 a night include internet but hotels that cost $400 a night charge for internet?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The valet/bell staff was kind and helpful; we loved them. The front desk was great to work with; amazingly accomodating. All of the employees on the site greet you with a smile.
reviews.title: Great Wailea resort without the pretense of the larger hotels

reviews.text: Grounds are immaculate. Great place to view the sunset.
reviews.title: What a wonderful resort!
Construction Site, or Ideal Paradise Location Site?
reviews.text: It would be hard to beat this hotel. The Wailea community is very upscale.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We started visiting this resort in 1988 on our honeymoon. For the next 10 years we stayed at this resort through the ownership changes from intercontinental to Aston to Outrigger to managed by Marriott. As those years transpired the resort went through various half attempts at remodeling. None were complete and most were stopped before completion due to "cost".
reviews.title: The postives and the negatives

likes.liked: — Our bed was like sleeping on a cloud. Awesome!!
likes.disliked: — Problems when requesting and using a wheel chair because of a sprained ankle.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I just got back from four nights at the Marriott Wailea. It's a beautiful resort, but overall, I'd say we were underwhelmed. I have a feeling that a lot of the issues with the hotel will be resolved once the construction is done, but as things stand, this resort did not measure up to other similarly-priced tropical resorts we've been to recently.
reviews.title: Okay but missing the mark during construction

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The good:
reviews.title: Nice Resort.........Enjoyed Our Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * The location: Maui is awesome and if you are willing to go just off the beaten path a little you can find good, local food and wonderful local beaches (Big Beach, for example). You'll need a car for sure.
reviews.title: Marriott - Some issues

likes.liked: — The views and the pool area
likes.disliked: — the front desk staff was inconsistent.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * First impression: The first impression when arriving at this resort is impressive. It is kind of a sprawling, open villa kind of view with open-air registration and fountains, etc.
reviews.title: Great Views but renovations ongoing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: * The luau - it was fun and the food was good. We didn't pay for it ourselves so I'm not sure how the pricing is.
reviews.title: Just awful aging property, stay away....

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Marriot Waleia is a beautiful hotel that is almost finished with their remolding. The beach is small and rocky. Their are different pool choices and a kiddy pool w/slide at on end of the property.There is a broadwalk that extends to Grand Waleia, Four SEasons and Kea Lani. The beach at Kea Lani is great. After being unhappy with 2 different rooms they gave us, the manager upgraded us to a great suite with 2 bathrooms and 2 terraces and 2 plasma televisions and refridge for the same price. The room was kept clean with housekeeping service twice a day. We mentioned it was a special anniversary and were given champagne.and other goodies. We stayed here with our Marriott points. We would have chosen a different place on the beach but the accomadations were deluxe.
reviews.title: Still Being Renovated

reviews.text: Great, accomodating staff plus the beautiful location make this a great place to relax. We were able to watch whales pass by from the pool deck and our balcony. There was a pool area for children but it did not seem to get the use that the pool closest to the beach walk did (unfortunately). I booked a spa appt. about 10 days before we arrived only to have it canceled a half hour before. I would have had to pay if I canceled so the fact that I was never contacted to reschedule was annoying. (The spa phone was answered 2 days later when I called to inquire and I was told the spa was closed). The dining room was closed and we found that inconvenient. Ate several meals at the Shops of Wailea mall area because we could walk. But again, the Marriott staff was top rate.
reviews.title: Beautiful location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Cannot say enough about the new adults only pool. We've stayed here in the past, and enjoyed the hotel and it's relaxed attitude among what can be stuffy Wailea. But the new serenity pool takes it over the top. We enjoyed sunset everynight relaxing in the pool with cocktails, the view can't be beat.
reviews.title: Serenity Pool Now

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They are still working on the restaurants, so we missed the new one that will open after we leave. The staff is very friendly, overall great experience. And did I mention the pool?
reviews.title: Perfect end to a Pacific trip

likes.liked: — Upscale place to relax without the upscale price
likes.disliked: — Food choices at poolside restaurant/lounge - not enough!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Spent 5 nights here at the end of a Pacific vacation which started with a 12 day cruise from Tahiti ending at Honolulu, then came to Maui. Compared to the Waikiki Marriott where we'd just stayed 2 nights, this property scores higher for relaxation, about the same on views. We'd not asked to be away from the construction since most of it was supposed to be finished by our arrival, but it was still ongoing in the open air lobby & the new serenity pool; however, we never heard any construction noise from our north-facing tower room, day or night -- only heard it when we were in the immediate vicinity during the day. The room was spacious (even tho it was their lowest class room), very clean, no odors or malfunctioning equipment, absolutely no other noises and service was top notch the whole way. Very relaxing way to end a great trip, & we'd stay again in a heartbeat when returning to Maui. Only drawback was not enough food choices at the poolside restaurant/lounge when the regular restaurant is closed, but you get SPECTACULAR sunset views from there. The beds were not the same European style featherbeds we've become accustomed to in other luxury Marriotts, but sleep issues did not occur because we were active every day. The beach for hotel guests is Ulua, located north of the property, and is good for swimming but not snorkeling. You have to use a rental car to find the good snorkel spots or book a tour that picks you up at the hotel. You can also easily access a 1.5 mile jogging/walking path along the shore that's great for exercise in the morning. Did not take advantage of the spa because we were too active with island adventures. Be sure to use the Concierge for booking island tours or excursions - she's very knowledgeable and can get you into a tour at the last minute.
reviews.title: Amazing Small Maui Resort

likes.liked: — The small, semi-private beach with great snorkeling
likes.disliked: — Cost of internet access was true gouging

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great town, Great Island!!
reviews.text: Let me start with this Island... Maui is unbelievable. Just unreal. It's like living in a postcard. Rent your own car and take the Road to Hana. Now to the town... Wailea is an upscale area on the SouthWest coast of Maui. Gorgeous scenery, beautiful beaches, and very friendly people. don't expect a rockin' nightlife, but that's not what you go to Hawaii for. The beaches in this area are phenomenal... Makena Beach, Wailea Beach Ula Beach, etc... all within a couple minutes. Now to the hotel... Absolutely beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous, the rooms are sublime, and the beds are to die for. Again, not much of a nightlife, but the pool scene is relaxing with waitress service and a convenient bar. Family friendly, but not overbearing. I was there on my honeymoon and I absolutely recommend this to newlyweds and families alike. Totally upscale and accommodating. you can't go wrong with the Marriott Waliea. Have fun!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Marriott Wailea in early October. We had a great stay. We knew about the construction and ended up staying on the side the property with the construction. They were upfront about it and asked if I still wanted to go through with the reservation. It was not that big of a deal. If I did not want to deal with construction, I would have chosen another hotel.
reviews.title: Loved the Marriott Wailea

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will stay the property was spread out and it took a few days to find the shortest distances between our room and garage, pool or restaurant.
reviews.title: Fabulous Time at the Marriott Wailea

likes.liked: — The view from our hotel and the pool..

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, I thought we received excellent service. My only real complaint was that they needed another pool side server. The one person they had was not enough and we waited awhile for our drinks. She worked her tail off so it was not like she was slow, but just had to serve a lot of people at the pool.
reviews.title: Perfect Trip - will com again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I though the pool area was nice. We only used the one in front of the hotel. The view of the ocean was nice and we could always find two chaise lounges to sit on.
reviews.title: Okay hotel- Will try somewhere else next time

likes.disliked: — No town or local flavor nearby
